Package slotmachine.model

Interface SlotMachine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GameCallbackCollection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SlotMachineImpl
    public interface SlotMachine
extends GameCallbackCollection
    The main interface in Further Programming Assignment.

    This interface should be implemented as SlotMachineImpl which has a two constructors. 

    public SlotMachineImpl()
    public SlotMachineImpl(Wheel wheel1, Wheel wheel2, Wheel wheel3, WinSettings winSettings)

    All the methods in the interface need to be carefully implemented as per the JavaDoc below.

    Author:
    Ross Nye
    See Also:
    GameCallbackCollection, Player

    • Method Detail

      • registerPlayer

        Player registerPlayer​(java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      int initialCredits)
        Registers a player to the Slot Machine.

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.registerPlayer(Player) method.

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the Player
        name - the name of the Player
        initialCredits - the initial credits for the Player
        Returns:
        the registered Player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases:
        • the supplied id is empty or null
        • the supplied name is empty or null
        • the supplied initialCredits is negative
        • the supplied id is invalid as its not the correct format
        See Also:
        Player

      • cashOut

        Player cashOut()
        Cashes out the currently registered player and removes them from the game.

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.cashOutPlayer(Player) method.

        To maintain proper state across the Slot Machine (and all it's callacks) this method should call resetBets().

        Returns:
        the previously registered Player
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no registered Player

      • addCredits

        void addCredits​(int credits)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds credits to the currently registered player.

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.addCredits(Player, int) method.

        Parameters:
        credits - the credits to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no registered Player
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied credits is not a positive amount

      • placeBet

        void placeBet​(int amount)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Places a bet of the specified amount on line #1

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.betUpdated(Player, int, LineNum) method.

        Hint: Avoid code duplication with the overloaded placeBet methods

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be bet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases:
        • the amount is not a positive number
        • the registered player does not have enough credits available
        • there is already a bet for line #1 exceeds the amount
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no registered player

      • placeBet

        void placeBet​(int amount,
              LineNum line)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Places a bet of the specified amount on the specified line number

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.betUpdated(Player, int, LineNum) method.

        Hint: Avoid code duplication with the overloaded placeBet methods

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be bet
        line - the line to place the bet on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases:
        • the amount is not a positive number
        • the registered player does not have enough credits available
        • there is already a bet for the specified line that exceeds the amount
        • if no line number (null) is supplied
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no registered player

      • placeBet

        void placeBet​(int amount,
              java.util.Set<LineNum> lines)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Places a bet of the specified amount on the specified line numbers

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.betUpdated(Player, int, java.util.Collection) method.

        Note: This should be an atomic operation, where a bet must be place on all lines requested or then entire request should fail (and potentially reset to what they were previously)

        Hint: Avoid code duplication with the overloaded placeBet methods

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be bet on each line
        lines - the set of line numbers to place the bet on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases:
        • the amount is not a positive number
        • the registered player does not have enough credits available to place a bet on all of the supplied lines
        • there is already a bet for any of the specified lines that exceeds the amount
        • if no line numbers (null) are supplied
        • if the set of line numbers is empty
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no registered player

      • placeBet

        void placeBet​(int amount,
              LineNum... lines)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Places a bet of the specified amount on the specified line numbers

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.betUpdated(Player, int, java.util.Collection) method.

        Note: This should be an atomic operation, where a bet must be place on all lines requested or then entire request should fail (and potentially reset to what they were previously)

        Hint: Avoid code duplication with the overloaded placeBet methods

        Hint: Inside the method lines is an array. See SlotMachineTest for use of this method

        Parameters:
        amount - the amount to be bet on each line
        lines - the line numbers to place the bet on
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases:
        • the amount is not a positive number
        • the registered player does not have enough credits available to place a bet on all of the supplied lines
        • there is already a bet for any of the specified lines that exceeds the amount
        • if no line numbers (null) are supplied
        • if the set of line numbers is empty
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no registered player

      • resetBets

        void resetBets()
        Resets all the bets for all the line numbers and updates the Player bet information.

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of this event via the GameCallback.betUpdated(Player, int, java.util.Collection) method

      • spinToWin

        SpinResult spinToWin​(int turns,
                     int delay)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Spin the wheels of the slot machine and applies the current bets at completion.

        With the exception of validating the player and bets (see below) this method should have exactly the same functionality as separately calling spin(int, int) and applySpinResult(SpinResult).

        Parameters:
        turns - the number of turns of the wheels
        delay - the delay between each turn
        Returns:
        the SpinResult that represent the lines at the end of the spin
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if turn less than 1, delay less than 0 or delay greater than 2000
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no registered player or valid bet
        See Also:
        spin(int, int), applySpinResult(SpinResult)

      • spin

        SpinResult spin​(int turns,
                int delay)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Spin the wheels of the slot machine. This methods may be run without any player or betting consequences (and can be used for testing).

        A turn is defined a advancing the slots of a wheel one position. An new (unseen) slot item will appear as the top of the wheel. The slot previously at the top moves to the centre and the previous centre slot moves to the bottom. The previous bottom slot is not longer visible.

        The turns parameter is used to determine how many times each wheel spins. All wheels must spin at least once. Wheel #1 should turn the same amount as specified by the turns parameter. Wheel #2 should turn 66% of that figure. Wheel #3 should turn 33% of the turns parameter.

        All wheels turn at the start of the spin, before Wheel #3 stops, leaving Wheel #1 and #2 spinning. Next Wheel #2 will stops turning leaving only Wheel #1 spinning until all the turns are complete.

        Between each turn "set" a delay of the supplied delay (in ms) should occur. the delay should occur turns - 1 times.

        Refer to the output trace to see spin in action.

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of each wheel turn via GameCallback.turnWheel(slotmachine.model.slots.Wheel, int) method and also of the final state of the three wheels via GameCallback.spinComplete(SpinResult)

        Parameters:
        turns - the number of turns of the wheels
        delay - the delay between each turn
        Returns:
        the SpinResult that represent the lines at the end of the spin
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if turn less than 1, delay less than 0 or delay greater than 2000
        See Also:
        spinToWin(int, int), Thread.sleep(long)

      • applySpinResult

        int applySpinResult​(SpinResult spinResult)
        Applies the results of the players bets after the completion of a spin.

        In normal situations this method would be private, but is public to facilitate testing (both for yourself and in marking).

        This method will examine all the SlotLine objects from SpinResult parameter. Using WinSettings.getWinOdds(SlotLine) to determine the outcome (win or loss) of each line.

        This method should notify all the current callbacks of the outcome of each line (whether bet on or not) via GameCallback.lineResult(Player, boolean, int, slotmachine.model.slots.SlotLine) method.

        The total outcome of the spin's bets should also be notified to the callbacks via GameCallback.betTotals(Player, int)

        Prior to this the players current bets should be reset if they can not be serviced (the player won't have enough credits) after the outcome (total) is applied. Otherwise the current bets remain unchanged.

        Parameters:
        spinResult - the SpinResult created during a spin
        Returns:
        the total credits won (or 0)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if slotDisplay is null
        See Also:
        spinToWin(int, int), resetBets()
